requirement.topic: The xmlBlaster.properties file allows you to use and define dynamic variables
requirement.description: The xmlBlaster.properties file allows to customize the behavior of xmlBlaster. See the example below.
requirement.example:
The variables which you specify with ${...} will be replaced by their values. The variable may be from the System properties, xmlBlaster.properties or from the command line.
For example you could define a variable in xmlBlaster.properties: XMLBLASTER_HOME=${user.home}/xmlBlaster and use it as a variable in this file, e.g. MY_XSL_DIR=${XMLBLASTER_HOME}/xsl Note the use of the JVM property 'user.home'.
Another example could be java -DmyName=joe ... and use it as a variable in this file, e.g. TEXT=Hello ${myName}, have a nice day.
